title: David Foster Wallace - Novels, Short Stories & Essays (13 bo
description:
DAVID FOSTER WALLACE (1962-2008) was an award-winning American novelist, short story writer, and essayist.  Hailed as "the best mind of his generation" (A. O. Scott) and "one of the most influential and innovative writers of the last 20 years" (David Ulin), Wallace is widely known for his novel INFINITE JEST (1996), which was cited as one of the 100 best English-language novels from 1923 to 2005 by Time magazine.  With his suicide, he left behind an unfinished novel, THE PALE KING, which was subsequently published in 2011 and was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize for fiction.

Included here are 3 novels, 3 short story collections, 6 volumes of essays and other non-fiction, and a compilation of interviews and conversations.  Thank you to all the original uploaders!


Unless otherwise indicated, all the following are in EPUB format:

* A SUPPOSEDLY FUN THING I'LL NEVER DO AGAIN: Essays and Arguments (Little, Brown, 1997)

* BOTH FLESH AND NOT: Essays (Little, Brown, 2012)

* BRIEF INTERVIEWS WITH HIDEOUS MEN: Stories (Little, Brown, 1999)

* THE BROOM OF THE SYSTEM (Penguin, 1987)

* CONSIDER THE LOBSTER & OTHER ESSAYS (Little, Brown, 2006) -- PDF + EPUB

* EVERYTHING AND MORE: A Compact History of Infinity (Norton, 2003) -- PDF

* FATE, TIME, AND LANGUAGE: An Essay on Free Will (Columbia University Press, 2011).  Edited by Steven M. Cahn and Maureen Eckert.

* GIRL WITH CURIOUS HAIR (Norton, 1989)

* INFINITE JEST (Little, Brown, 1996)

* THE LAST CONVERSATION & OTHER CONVERSATIONS (Melville House, 2012)

* OBLIVION: Stories (Little, Brown, 2004) -- PDF + EPUB

* THE PALE KING (Little, Brown, 2011)

* UP, SIMBA! (Little, Brown, 2000)
